Package de.rumford.tradingsystem.helper

Class ValueDateTupel

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.rumford.tradingsystem.helper.ValueDateTupel
  • public class ValueDateTupel
extends Object
    A ValueDateTupel represents a decimal value at a given point in time.

    The ValueDateTupel is the most used helper class in this library. It consists of a LocalDateTime value representing a point in time, and of a double, representing any kind of decimal value associated with the aforementioned point in time. By using LocalDateTime (an not just a class representing Date values) intraday usage is possible.

    The ValueDateTupel brings a lot of static method used throughout the entire library. Most of these methods deal with arrays or larger structures of ValueDateTupel, as the instance of ValueDateTupel by itself does not have many limitations.

    Author:
    Max Rumford

      • addOneAt

        public static ValueDateTupel[] addOneAt​(ValueDateTupel[] valueDateTupels,
                                        ValueDateTupel vdtToBeAdded,
                                        int position)
        Adds a given ValueDateTupel to the given array of ValueDateTupel at the given position. Returns the given array extended with the given single value.
        Parameters:
        valueDateTupels - ValueDateTupel[] Array to be extended.
        vdtToBeAdded - ValueDateTupel Value to be added.
        position - int Position the given value shall be put into.
        Returns:
        ValueDateTupel[] The extended array.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given array is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given value to be added is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the position is negative.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given position is greater than the length of the given array.

      • alignDates

        public static ValueDateTupel[][] alignDates​(ValueDateTupel[][] valueDateTupels)
        Add missing LocalDateTime values to all given ValueDateTupel[]. The corresponding value will be set to average the values of its direct predecessor and successor.

        If there are multiple LocalDateTime missing in a row, all of those will get the average value of the last position before and the first position after all missing values.

        If the missing LocalDateTime would be the first value in the new array, its value will be set to match the previously first one.

        If the missing LocalDateTime would be the last value in the new array, its value will be set to match the previously last one.

        Parameters:
        valueDateTupels - ValueDateTupel[][] Array of arrays of ValueDateTupel whose LocalDateTime shall be aligned.
        Returns:
        ValueDateTupel[][] Array of arrays of ValueDateTupel with now aligned LocalDateTime values.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given array of arrays is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given array of arrays contains null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If any array of the given array of arrays contains null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given array contains an array of ValueDateTupel not sorted in ascending order.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the one of the given arrays contains only Double.NaN.

      • contains

        public static boolean contains​(ValueDateTupel[] valueDateTupels,
                               ValueDateTupel vdtToBeFound)
        Check if the given ValueDateTupel can be found in the given array of ValueDateTupel. Will only find exact matches.
        Parameters:
        valueDateTupels - ValueDateTupel[] Array to be searched in.
        vdtToBeFound - ValueDateTupel Value to be searched for.
        Returns:
        boolean True, if the given value can be found in the given array, false otherwise.

        public static boolean containsDate​(ValueDateTupel[] valueDateTupels,

        Check if the given array of ValueDateTupel contains the given LocalDateTime.
        Parameters:
        valueDateTupels - ValueDateTupel[] Array to be searched in.
        dtToBeFound - LocalDateTime Value to be searched for.
        Returns:
        boolean True, if the given value can be found inside the given array, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given array of ValueDateTupel is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given LocalDateTime is null.

      • getElement

        public static ValueDateTupel getElement​(ValueDateTupel[] valueDateTupels,
                                        LocalDateTime dtToBeFound)
        Check if the BaseValue instance contains the given LocalDateTime in its values. Returns the containing ValueDateTupel if so, returns null otherwise.
        Parameters:
        valueDateTupels - ValueDateTupel[] The array of ValueDateTupel to be searched through.
        dtToBeFound - LocalDateTime Value to be found inside the BaseValue values.
        Returns:
        ValueDateTupel containing the given LocalDateTime. null if the given LocalDateTime cannot be found.

      • getElements

        public static ValueDateTupel[] getElements​(ValueDateTupel[] valueDateTupels,
                                           LocalDateTime dtFrom,
                                           LocalDateTime dtTo)
        Get all elements between two given DateTimes (inclusive) from the given array. If null is passed for either LocalDateTime, the representing border will be set to the boundaries of the given array.
        Parameters:
        valueDateTupels - ValueDateTupel[] The base array.
        dtFrom - LocalDateTime The first DateTime to be included. If null, all values up until dtTo will be given.
        dtTo - LocalDateTime The last DateTime to be included. If null, all values starting from dtFrom will be given.
        Returns:
        ValueDateTupel[] The found elements. null, if dtFrom or dtTo cannot be found in the given array.

      • getDates

        public static LocalDateTime[] getDates​(ValueDateTupel[] valueDateTupels)
        Get all LocalDateTime from an array of ValueDateTupel.
        Parameters:
        valueDateTupels - ValueDateTupel[] An array of ValueDateTupel}.
        Returns:
        LocalDateTime[] An array of LocalDateTime of the given ValueDateTupel[]. Returns an empty array if the given array is empty.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given array is null.

      • getPosition

        public static int getPosition​(ValueDateTupel[] valueDateTupels,
                              LocalDateTime dtToBeFound)
        Finds the position of a given LocalDateTime in a given array of ValueDateTupel.
        Parameters:
        valueDateTupels - ValueDateTupel[] The array to be searched.
        dtToBeFound - LocalDateTime The value to be found.
        Returns:
        int The position the given LocalDateTime was found. If the given LocalDateTime cannot be found, Integer.MIN_VALUE is returned. If the given array's length is 0 Integer.MIN_VALUE is returned.

        public static double[] getValues​(ValueDateTupel[] valueDateTupels)

        Parameters:
        valueDateTupels - ValueDateTupel[] An array of ValueDateTupel}.
        Returns:

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given array is null.

      • isSortedAscending

        public static boolean isSortedAscending​(ValueDateTupel[] valueDateTupels)
                                 throws IllegalArgumentException
        Evaluate if the given array of ValueDateTupel is sorted in ascending order, i.e., if the value at position 0 has the lowest LocalDateTime value (implicit check) and all subsequent ValueDateTupel each have a LocalDateTime after (LocalDateTime.isAfter(ChronoLocalDateTime)) the previous one.

        If two values have the same LocalDateTime false will be returned.

        Parameters:
        valueDateTupels - ValueDateTupel[] array of ValueDateTupel to be checked for ascending order.
        Returns:
        boolean False, if any date is not chronologically after its predecessor, true if otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given array is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given array contains null values.

      • isSortedDescending

        public static boolean isSortedDescending​(ValueDateTupel[] valueDateTupels)
        Evaluate if the given array of ValueDateTupel is sorted in descending order, i.e., if the value at position 0 has the highest LocalDateTime value (implicit check) and all subsequent ValueDateTupel each have a LocalDateTime before (LocalDateTime.isBefore(ChronoLocalDateTime)) the previous one.

        If two values have the same LocalDateTime false will be returned.

        Parameters:
        valueDateTupels - ValueDateTupel[] array of ValueDateTupel to be checked for descending order.
        Returns:
        boolean False, if any date is not chronologically before its predecessor, true if otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given array is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - If the given array contains null values.
